definition: uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Upslope fog is usually dense, and extends to high altitudes.
sentences.chinese: 上坡雾通常是密集，并延伸到高海拔地区。

sentences.english: The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.
sentences.chinese: 这位老人攀爬这条峻峭的上坡路有困难。

sentences.english: He ascended the incline, and turned to the right.
Stgot-owned enterprises collect out of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业下手走上坡路。

sentences.english: Changes of Zhang's mental state of producing and the improving tendency in his way of producing.
sentences.chinese: 张恨水创作心态的变化及他在创作上的上坡路趋势。

sentences.english: The last part of the ascent is very steep.
There was a steep climb on the road out of town.
sentences.chinese: 市外公路上有一处很陡的上坡路。

sentences.english: No matter which way you have to march, its always uphill.
sentences.chinese: 不管你从哪条路线行军，都是上坡路。

sentences.english: Lying face down on the hillside, his head pointing uphill.
sentences.chinese: 在上坡上脸朝下躺着，头部朝向山顶。

sentences.english: You run up the hill fast and then recover by jogging or walking down.
sentences.chinese: 您快速地跑上坡，通过慢跑或走下坡进行恢复。

sentences.english: Side-stepping is one way of moving uphill with your Skis on.
sentences.chinese: 横板上升是穿着雪板上坡的一种方法。

sentences.english: The road made an abrupt rise up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 上坡时，这条路有个陡坡。

sentences.english: This year I was able to run more of the uphills and finish stronger than I did.
sentences.chinese: 今年上坡还能用跑的，比我想像中的状况还要好。

sentences.english: Most patients find that their claudication symptoms are worse on walking uphill.
sentences.chinese: 大多数病人发现上坡时跛行症状更严重。

sentences.english: He saw nothing but forest, trees running upslope , mighty oaks, broad of girth and rough-barked.
sentences.chinese: 但他只看到森林，很多粗皮的大橡树在上坡。

sentences.english: The ascent was steep and difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这上坡路很陡峭及坚难。

definition: to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to turn/to go around a corner
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
